ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course provides a broad overview to some of the foundational texts within the field of sociocultural anthropology. I would recommend this class especially for those, like me, who do not have a prior background in anthropology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It trained me in ways to read, contextualize, and think about ethnographies as not just standalone texts, but part of a process of fieldwork, theorizing, synthesizing, and writing.

The course allowed me to deepen ethnographic knowledge around my particular topic of interest as well as engage in theoretical questions. At the same time as it helped me prepare for my concentration, we read classics of ethnography that zoomed out to the discipline of anthropology in general.
